Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Nan's Dilemma
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan and her complex relationship with Ghost Town, juxtaposed with the threat of modern development and her personal conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction and Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Nan, her stubborn character, and her initial rejection of Cal's romantic advances and suggestion to visit Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and the Stubborn Woman

sub_scenes.title: Solo Trip and Modern Threat
sub_scenes.description: Nan decides to visit Ghost Town alone, reflecting on her past. The scene abruptly shifts to the modern day, revealing the impending destruction of Ghost Town for an airport and Nan's emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflections on the Ghost Town
Disbelief, Explanation, and Nan's Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Reconciliation and the Snowstorm Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's reconciliation amidst the backdrop of a devastating snowstorm and the community's struggle for survival.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Arrival at Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile, leading to Nan's arrival at the transformed Ghost Town where she confronts the construction workers.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Arrival at the Transformed Ghost Town and Dismay

sub_scenes.title: Family Conflict and Humiliation
sub_scenes.description: Nan's conflict with her father escalates over the airport project and her forced participation in it, leading to emotional distress and humiliation.

sub_scenes.title: Parental Perspectives and Nan's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Nan's parents offer contrasting views on love and courtship, while a maid's encouragement inspires Nan to seek clarity about her feelings for Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Defiance over Horses
sub_scenes.description: Nan seeks out Cal, but their interaction is interrupted by the demand for her to help with horses for the airport, leading to her defiance.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Confession, Impulsive Action, and Loneliness
sub_scenes.description: Nan confesses her feelings to Cal, followed by an impulsive act of horse wrangling and a period of growing loneliness.

sub_scenes.title: Accusations, Weather Warning, and Hope
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal's strained interaction is juxtaposed with escalating weather warnings and a glimmer of hope amidst the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Defensiveness in the Snow
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst the Storm

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Rescue, and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Despair turns to hope with the arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift', leading to community relief and Nan and Cal's romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Waking Up to Snow and Hopelessness
The Sound of a Plane and Hopeful Fodder Drop
Joyful Recognition of Fodder and Cal's Foresight

Major_Arcs.title: The Ballad of Chane Benson and Jeff
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to a new storyline involving Chane Benson, Jeff, and Sally, exploring themes of admiration, influence, and conflict in a Western town.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced through his actions and the varied reactions of the townspeople, establishing his presence and impact.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Past and Gun Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Jeff's past is revealed through Sally's reminiscence, followed by a confrontation about his fascination with guns and his admiration for a criminal.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Jeff's Brother and Past

sub_scenes.title: Sally and Clyde's Concern for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her fears about Jeff's path to Clyde, leading to a shared resolve to guide Jeff and secure their own relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Fear and Plea to Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Article, Warning, and Accusation
sub_scenes.description: A newspaper article becomes a point of contention, leading to warnings about Benson and a heated confrontation between Sally and Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense of Past Actions and Article Mention
Warning about Benson and the Article

sub_scenes.title: Journalistic Duty and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Benson defends his journalistic duty, leading to a dinner invitation and a setup for potential reconciliation or conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Article's Impact and Doubts about Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Dinner, Moonlight, and Mistaken Identity
sub_scenes.description: A dinner scene leads to a moonlit encounter and a dramatic realization of mistaken identity, escalating the central conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Jealousy, Fight, and Urgent Warning
sub_scenes.description: Jealousy leads to a physical fight, and Sally's subsequent warning about Clyde's danger prompts a rescue mission.

sub_scenes.title: Fight Challenge and Newspaper Resolution
sub_scenes.description: A fight challenge is accepted, leading to a shift in the newspaper headline and a resolution to the immediate conflict, culminating in a family legacy.

narrative_arcs.title: Challenge for a Fair Fight and Anxious Wait
Printing the Clarion and Family Legacy

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Betsy's Resolve
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting and characters, focusing on a brewing range war, Betsy's leadership, and romantic entanglements.

sub_scenes.title: Western Fight and New Boss Introduction
sub_scenes.description: A physical fight over 'gunplay' introduces a Western setting, followed by the arrival of Steve Daley as the new boss.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as 'The Boss'
Discussion of Betsy's Ranch and Approaching Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Clarifying Roles and Range War Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Steve Daley clarifies his role while concerns about a potential range war and local troubles escalate.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarifying Steve Daley's Role and Concerns
Discussion of Impending Range War and Local Troubles
Offer of a Ride and Acceptance
Hank's Orders and Waiting for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Post-Purchase Confrontation and Warning
sub_scenes.description: A post-shopping conversation leads to a violent confrontation, highlighting Steve Daley's dangerous skills and foreshadowing danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Purchase Conversation and Steve Daley Mention
Discussion of Steve Daley's Abilities and Impending Danger

sub_scenes.title: Bodyguard Decision and Ranch Philosophy
sub_scenes.description: Betsy decides to hire Steve Daley as a bodyguard, clarifying her ranch philosophy and personnel decisions.

narrative_arcs.title: Decision to Hire Bodyguard and Ranch Philosophy
Clarification on Firing and Stance Against Gunslingers
Gratitude, Personnel Change, and Hank Yuh's Request

sub_scenes.title: Gun Ultimatum and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Betsy gives Steve Daley a gun ultimatum, leading to confessions of love and a difficult choice.

narrative_arcs.title: Love's Proof and Surrender of Guns

sub_scenes.title: Declaration of War and Hank's Ambush
sub_scenes.description: Ominous foreshadowing precedes a declaration of war and the ambush of Hank, escalating the ranch conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Declaration of War and Betsy's Authority

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Defiance and Devil's Pass Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy's pleas fail to stop Steve from going to Devil's Pass, leading to a violent confrontation and rescue operation.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath and Suspense at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Mary, Dave, and the Love Triangle
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a love triangle involving Mary, Dave, and Fred, exploring themes of jealousy, deception, and romantic choices.

sub_scenes.title: Accusation and Concern for Curley
sub_scenes.description: Mary confronts Dave and expresses concern about Curley's unusual behavior, setting up a subplot involving Curley.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Unexpected Encounter
sub_scenes.description: A fence complaint leads to an unexpected encounter and escalating tension at the fence line.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Visitors and Accusation of Fence Damage

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath, Romantic Interlude, and Interruption
sub_scenes.description: The aftermath of the fence confrontation is followed by a romantic interlude between Carrie and Dave, abruptly interrupted by Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Confusion about Friendship and Second Chances
Romantic Interlude and Dismissal of Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Betrayal Realization
sub_scenes.description: Conversations reveal love confessions, but also lead to Carrie's realization of Fred's manipulative intentions regarding the Carlton contract.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love for Fred Gordon
Desire to Bury the Hatchet and Romantic Overture
Flashback to Romantic Words and Proposal
Discussion about Dave and the Carlton Contract

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation at Carlton's Office and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Fred at Carlton's office, leading to emotional fallout, her father's comfort, and an ambiguous resolution regarding the contract.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office

sub_scenes.title: Final Confessions and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Final confrontations and confessions lead to Carrie admitting her love for Fred and their eventual romantic reunion, intertwined with past reflections.

narrative_arcs.title: Apology and Inquiry about Feelings for Fred
Wagon Ride and Direct Confrontation about Love
The Beef Contract Revelation and Reconciliation with Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Crisis and Ransom's Dilemma
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on Dirk's gunshot wound and escape, forcing Ransom into a moral and professional dilemma, leading to a dramatic confrontation and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Urgent Plea and Secret Meeting
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's urgent arrival and plea for help lead to a secret meeting and the revelation of his gunshot wound.

narrative_arcs.title: Dirk's Urgent Arrival and Plea for Help
The Secret Meeting and Dirk's Disguise
Dirk's Gunshot Wound and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Marshal Ransom's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: An investigation into Dirk's situation is initiated, followed by Marshal Ransom's arrival and inquiry about Dirk's whereabouts.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Investigation into Dirk's Situation
Marshal Ransom's Arrival and Inquiry about Dirk
Confrontation with Rance Cready and Suspicion at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Legal Stance and Plea for Leniency
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Ransom asserts the legal implications of Dirk's actions while the woman pleads for leniency and time for Dirk to recover.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: A heated argument leads to love confessions and the proposal of an escape plan for Dirk, testing Ransom's moral and professional boundaries.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape Plan Proposal and Seeming Agreement

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Gunfight, and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: The escape attempt leads to a pursuit and violent gunfight, forcing a moral dilemma upon Dirk and Chris regarding the injured Marshal.

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Return, and Confession of Love
sub_scenes.description: Dirk escapes while Chris returns to Ransom, leading to a confession of love and a dramatic revelation of Chris's deception.

sub_scenes.title: Recovery, Questioning, and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Ransom recovers, leading to emotional questioning, love confessions, and a marriage proposal amidst the aftermath.

sub_scenes.title: Pre-Wedding Anxieties and Interruption
sub_scenes.description: Pre-wedding anxieties are interrupted by Dirk's dramatic and unexpected arrival, setting up a final confrontation.
